title: Patient Leaves a Negative Google Review
summary: A patient complains online about wait time. Respond professionally without defensiveness; choose public reply versus private outreach and improve the patient flow system.

scene.setting: A patient complains online about wait time. The review is visible publicly. You feel reputation anxiety; the hidden risk is team morale. The decision point is public reply versus private outreach.

beats.narration: The negative review is live. The decision point is public reply versus private first.

dialogue.speaker: lead
dialogue.line: We take feedback seriously. I want to respond in a way that repairs trust and improves our system.

choices.label: Reply publicly with an apology and commitment to improve.

steps.step: Post brief public apology and one concrete improvement.
Identify one operational change (buffer time, check-in protocol).

leader_lines: We're sorry. Here's one change we're making.
scripts.closing_line: Public accountability plus one system fix.

choices.label: Reach out to the patient privately first, then post a brief public response.

steps.step: Contact patient privately; listen and commit to one fix.

leader_lines: I'd like to hear from you directly. What would make it right?
questions: How do we prevent similar issues?
scripts.closing_line: Private repair first; then public accountability.

choices.label: Do not reply publicly; address internally only.

steps.step: Internal debrief; decide one case when to reply publicly.

leader_lines: We'll learn internally. When do we reply publicly?
questions: What's our policy for public response?
scripts.closing_line: One clear guideline for next time.

choices.label: Reply defensively and explain why the wait happened.

steps.step: Replace with one sentence of empathy and one commitment.

leader_lines: We hear you. Here's what we're doing.
questions: How do we train on review response?

system_prompts.nudge: Private repair plus public accountability is strongest.

outcomes.message: Another review appears. Unanswered or defensive replies may have hurt perception.
reflection_questions: What would have changed with private-first outreach?
How do you set review response standards?

outcomes.message: The patient felt heard. Wait-time expectations or updates are in place; reputation improved.
reflection_questions: How do you prevent similar complaints?

tsp.weekly_pulse_prompt: This week we responded to feedback without defensiveness. (1-5)
